I told him we needed a written statement from the well driller about his findings with well no 1 and its being unrecoverable. On 9/17/2020, the Division received a complaint call from Mrs. Adele Johnson (resident in Harrison) who stated that her water had white floating. On 9/21/2020, as a representative of the Division, I investigated regarding the complaint at Mrs. Johnson's house spigots outside the house. The samples did show the white sediments in the water (picture 1 & 2), which was limestone due to the hardness and calcium ion in the water. Other than that, the water at a resident's house had no problem or issue at the time of the investigation. Richard recommended Mrs. Johnson install a water softener which would effectively reduce the amount of limestone/white sediment in her water. After the investigation at Mrs. Johnson's house, I collected another two water samples from two random locations with the distribution system (picture 3 & 4). The water samples were perfectly clear without any white sediments or floating, which indicates that the water flowing in the distribution system is okay and there is no limestone clog.
